org.epics.ioc.support
Interface RecordProcess

public interface RecordProcess

Record processing support.

Author:
mrk

Method Detail

isEnabled

boolean isEnabled()
Is the record enabled.

Returns:
(false,true) if the record (is not, is) enabled

setEnabled

boolean setEnabled(boolean value)
Set the enable state to the requested value.

Parameters:
value - true or false.
Returns:
(false,true) if the state (was not, was) changed.

isActive

boolean isActive()
Is the record active.

Returns:
(false,true) if the record (is not, is) active.

getRecord

org.epics.pvData.pv.PVRecord getRecord()
Get the record this RecordProcess processes.

Returns:
The PVRecord interface.

isTrace

boolean isTrace()
Is trace active for this record.

Returns:
(false,true) if trace (is not, is) active

setTrace

boolean setTrace(boolean value)
Set trace true. If true a message will displayed whenever process, requestProcessCallback, or processContinue are called.

Parameters:
value - true or false.
Returns:
(false,true) if the state (was not, was) changed.

getSupportState

SupportState getSupportState()
Get the current record support state.

Returns:
The state.

initialize

void initialize()
Initialize. This must be called rather than directly calling record support. This handles global nodes like scan and then calls record support.

start

void start(AfterStart afterStart)
JavaIOC. This must be called rather than directly calling record support. This handles global nodes like scan and then calls record support.

Parameters:
afterStart - interface for being called after all support has started.

stop

void stop()
Stop. This must be called rather than directly calling record support. This handles global nodes like scan and then calls record support. If the record is active when stop is called then the record will not be stopped until the record completes the current process request.

uninitialize

void uninitialize()
Uninitialize. This must be called rather than directly calling record support. This handles global nodes like scan and then calls record support. If the record is active when uninitialize is called then the record will not be uninitialized until the record completes the current process request.

setRecordProcessRequester

boolean setRecordProcessRequester(RecordProcessRequester recordProcessRequester)
Attempt to become the record processor, i.e. the code that can call process and preProcess.

Parameters:
recordProcessRequester - The interface implemented by the record processor.
Returns:
(false,true) if the caller (is not, is) has become the record processor.

releaseRecordProcessRequester

boolean releaseRecordProcessRequester(RecordProcessRequester recordProcessRequester)
Release the current record processor.

Parameters:
recordProcessRequester - The current record processor.
Returns:
(false,true) if the caller (is not, is) has been released as the record processor. This should only fail if the caller was not the record processor.

releaseRecordProcessRequester

void releaseRecordProcessRequester()
Release the record processor unconditionally. This should only be used if a record processor failed without calling releaseRecordProcessor.

getRecordProcessRequesterName

java.lang.String getRecordProcessRequesterName()
Get the name of the current record processor.

Returns:
The name of the current record processor or null if no record processor is registered.

setActive

boolean setActive(RecordProcessRequester recordProcessRequester)
Prepare for processing a record but do not call record support. A typical use of this method is when the processor wants to modify nodes of the record before it is processed. If successful the record is active but unlocked.

Parameters:
recordProcessRequester - The recordProcessRequester.
Returns:
(false,true) if the request was successful. If false is returned then recordProcessRequester.message is called to report the reason.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if recordProcessRequester is null.

process

boolean process(RecordProcessRequester recordProcessRequester,
                boolean leaveActive,
                org.epics.pvData.property.TimeStamp timeStamp)
Process the record instance. Unless the record was activated by setActive, the record is prepared for processing just like for setActive. All results of record processing are reported via the RecordProcessRequester methods.

Parameters:
recordProcessRequester - The recordProcessRequester.
leaveActive - Leave the record active when process is done. The requester must call setInactive.
timeStamp - The initial timeStamp for record processing. If null the initial timeStamp will be the current time.
Returns:
(false,true) if the request was successful. If false is returned then recordProcessRequester.message is called to report the reason.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if recordProcessRequester is null.

setInactive

void setInactive(RecordProcessRequester recordProcessRequester)
Called by the recordProcessRequester when it has called process with leaveActive true and is done.

Parameters:
recordProcessRequester -

canProcessSelf

ProcessSelf canProcessSelf()
Is the record self processed. A self processed record allows multiple Record Process Requesters.

Returns:
Return the ProcessSelf interface or null if the record is not self processed.

processContinue

void processContinue(ProcessContinueRequester processContinueRequester)
Ask recordProcess to continue processing. This must be called with the record unlocked. ProcessContinueRequester.processContinue will be called with the record locked. Only valid if the record is active.

Parameters:
processContinueRequester - The requester to call.

requestProcessCallback

void requestProcessCallback(ProcessCallbackRequester processCallbackRequester)
Request to be called back after process or processContinue has called support but before it returns. This must only be called by code implementing Support.process() or ProcessContinueRequester.processContinue(), which means that it is called with the record locked. ProcessCallbackRequester.processCallback() will be called with the record unlocked.

Parameters:
processCallbackRequester - The requester to call.

setTimeStamp

void setTimeStamp(org.epics.pvData.property.TimeStamp timeStamp)
Set the timeStamp for the record. This must only be called by code implementing process or processContinue.

Parameters:
timeStamp - The timeStamp.

getTimeStamp

void getTimeStamp(org.epics.pvData.property.TimeStamp timeStamp)
Get the current timeStamp. This must only be called by code implementing process or processContinue.

Parameters:
timeStamp - The current timeStamp.
